alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:34AM CDT until October 29 at 1:22AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 85.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 84.0 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 88.3 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon to 71.7 feet late this evening. It will rise to 75.5 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
